Oracle Database Administrator
- In this new role, you will be provided DBA services to application development teams, including database design, database generation, coding, and database production support. Provide DBA support with a high degree of customer service, technical expertise, and timeliness. Provide accurate and creative solutions to user problems of moderate nature to ensure user productivity.
You Will
-  Maintain high availability and reliability of databases
-  Perform daily Health Check, database maintenance and database security self-assessment.
-  Perform database creation, configuration and migration, apply patches and technology upgrade to keep the databases at supported level
-  Database Capacity Planning
-  Ensure that the database assets and systems are managed in accordance with the security policies and standards [This includes Account Reviews]
-  Responsible for documenting database related policy, architecture and design artefact.
-  Provide technical expertise and solutions based on user requirements for database-related project.
You Bring
-  Experience in supporting Oracle Database environments PROD/DR/DEV/QA/UAT
-  Strong experience in Database Administration in Oracle version (11g/12c/18C/19C)
-  Experience in supporting high availability Oracle RAC environment (2/3/4 node clusters), Oracle Golden Gate, Oracle Data Guard
-  Experience in troubleshooting and resolving database integrity issues, performance issues, blocking and deadlocking issues, connectivity issues, security issues
-  Strong Knowledge in Operating systems like windows and Unix
-  Generating reports in Oracle database using tools like AWR, ASH, ADDM and manual scripts.
-  Provide continuous monitoring, troubleshooting, historical and real time performance monitoring of the Oracle.
-  Strong Experience of RMAN, expdp/impdp, Backup/Recovery
-  Experience in evaluating and Installing new software releases, patches, upgrade and Database cloning
-  Experience in developing and executing database security policies, procedures
-  Daily health monitoring of database system and data integrity checks
-  Collect and analyse database performance information, identify and implement solutions for performance problems
-  Experience with other RDBMS, NO SQL, cloud platforms will be added advantage
-  Good communication skills English (written, spoken) and Documentation skills for processes and procedures (creating KBs, runbooks, topology)
-  Work with users, vendors to take timely and appropriate steps to resolve and troubleshoot issues impacting service levels and conduct root cause analysis
